##### My work 

I conduct research in the field of population health and health inequalities related to smoking, alcohol and other substance use addiction. My research uses a systems lens, recognising that behaviour change is influenced by multiple factors at the individual, community and population level.

##### Key Skills

- **Data analysis & visualisation**
  - Statistical modelling and analysis of population survey data and randomized controlled trial data
  - Data wrangling and statistical programming using R
  - Qualitative data analysis
  <br>
  <br>
- **Communication**
  - Oral presentation of research at international academic research conferences and to policy-focused stakeholders
  - Lecture to MSc and BSc programmes in epidemiology, behaviour change, addiction and public health
  - Report writing and publication of research in academic journals
  - Communication of research to public audiences

##### Experience

- Post-doctoral Associate in the [Vermont Centre on Behavior and Health](http://www.med.uvm.edu/behaviorandhealth/home) at the University of Vermont. 2022-Present
- Post-doctoral Research Fellow in the [Tobacco and Alcohol Research Group](https://www.ucl.ac.uk/epidemiology-health-care/research/behavioural-science-and-health/research/ucl-tobacco-alcohol-research-group-utarg) at University College London. 2020-2022
<br>
- Analyst at [My Clinical Outcomes](https://www.myclinicaloutcomes.com/). 2016-2017
